form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Warren (for herself and Mr. Manchin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To require the President to make the text of trade agreements available to the public in order for those agreements to receive expedited consideration from Congress.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Trade Transparency Act of 2015.

section.header: Public availability of text of trade agreements

subsection.text: Unless the President, not later than 60 days before the date of the enactment of an Act to provide the President with trade promotion authority, makes available to the public the scrubbed bracketed text of a trade agreement, the expedited procedures for the consideration of implementing bills under that Act shall not apply to the implementing bill submitted to Congress with respect to that agreement.
Federal statutory law adopted after the date of the enactment of this Act is subject to this Act unless such law explicitly excludes such application by reference to this Act.
